ambition.question: Did my desire for power influence how I treat others in social situations, such as community events and gatherings?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that may have overshadowed or compromised my relationships with others
ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to motivate me in ways that may have overshadowed or compromised my relationships with others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I interacted with others, potentially leading them astray from God's authority?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did my accumulation of wealth make acquiring more possessions a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

oppression.question: Did I mistreat others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: through my words , actions , or attitudes
oppression.question: Have I ever mistreated others through my words, actions, or attitudes, causing them harm or feeling of oppression?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.question: Did I oppress, exploit, or otherwise mistreat others through my actions?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

presumption.question: Did I assume that my financial security, comfort, and leisure time were solely due to my own careful planning and hard work, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence in all things?
presumption.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: such as their good fortune , prosperity , or success
envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others' blessings, such as their good fortune, prosperity, or success, would somehow be taken away from them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: with vulgar or inappropriate language , particularly in social interactions where maintaining decorum is expected
particularly in social interactions where maintaining decorum is expected
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or inappropriate language, particularly in social interactions where maintaining decorum is expected?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or hurtful language, thereby violating their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or inappropriate language when engaging in conversations, perhaps while exercising your freedom of speech or participating in social activities?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
especially during times of celebration or when engaging in pleasurable activities
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially during times of celebration or when engaging in pleasurable activities?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
in enjoyable activities such as cooking , entertaining guests , or
such as cooking , entertaining guests , or
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, particularly while engaging in enjoyable activities such as cooking, entertaining guests, or participating in hobbies?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, thereby neglecting your responsibility to use God-given resources temperately?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful gambling to take precedence over my financial responsibilities and meeting the needs of myself and others?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively risked financial resources entrusted to me for unnecessary gambling, thereby neglecting my family's needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: over my financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I excessively and wastefully engaged in gambling, prioritizing it over my financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
in conversations or social gatherings relationships are being formed or where strengthened
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, in conversations or social gatherings where relationships are being formed or strengthened?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
in conversations at community events , family gatherings ,
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, while engaging in conversations at community events, family gatherings, or through phone calls/visits?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did you deliberately work on a Sunday, setting aside time that could have been reserved for rest and relaxation?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

anger.question: Have I nursed anger against those closest to me, rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
